title: Could Tonga's king take his political power back? | ABC NEWS
description: Tonga's the Pacific's only remaining monarchy, and while 2010 reforms removed a lot of the Crown's power to appoint government positions, some are now saying that should change. With elections under way this week, it's become a contentious debate between the country's nobility and democracy advocates. title: Meta gets in early on teen social media ban | ABC NEWS
description: Meta has begun giving hundreds of thousands of Australian teens a two-week warning to "download or delete" their account data from Instagram, Facebook and Threads.  The law preventing under 16s from holding accounts does not take effect until December 10, but the company will start purging accounts from December 4.  Meta is racing to remove at least 350,000 users from Instagram and 150,000 from Facebook by the deadline, with more expected to follow.  By the Specialist Reporting Team. title: Uni's sexual assault support service facing redundancies, despite shocking findings | ABC NEWS
description: The University of Wollongong is being urged to reverse redundancies in its sexual assault support service known as SARC. This comes weeks before the introduction of a tough new code compelling universities across Australia to prevent gender-based violence.  The code is a result of years of advocacy and shocking survey results showing that one in six students at universities across the country experienced sexual harassment but just 3 per cent made formal complaints.    Sexual assault support services: 1800RESPECT: 1800 737 732 National Sexual Abuse and Redress Support Service: 1800 211 028 Bravehearts: 1800 272 831  Video by ABC Specialist Reporting Team   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Trump boycotts G20 summit, while Anthony Albanese and other world leaders arrive | ABC NEWS
description: On the eve of the G20 leaders' summit in Johannesburg the White House has escalated its fued with South Africa, confirming once again that Donald Trump will not be attending. The US president is boycotting the major global summit that's still being attended by dozens of world leaders, including Anthony Albanese. National Affairs Correspondent Jane Norman is travelling with the prime minister. title: Global market sell-off worsens as ASX, Nvidia and Bitcoin fall sharply | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The ASX has suffered its worst trading week since April, when US President Donald Trump announced his 'Liberation Day' tariffs.  It follows a renewed sell-off across global share markets on lingering concerns about the high valuations of Nvidia and other AI-related stocks, while the original cryptocurrency Bitcoin has fallen deeper into a bear market. title: Bulk-billing rates flatline, despite billions tipped into Medicare | ABC NEWS
description: Quarterly Medicare data shows bulk-billing rates are unimproved from a year ago, and out of pocket costs have tipped over $50 for the first time, despite billions being poured into the scheme. The government is defending its tripling of the bulk-billing incentive, but some health experts warn investments made won't improve quality of care. title: Concerns from EU on US-backed plan to end war in Ukraine | ABC NEWS
description: Senior Pentagon officials have been meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv to discuss Donald Trump's latest attempt to end the war. Zelenskyy has been given a draft peace plan by the US, but there are concerns from the EU about what Ukraine is being asked to give up. Meanwhile, Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited a command post near the frontline as Moscow's forces say they're closing in on Ukrainian territory. title: Neo-Nazi Joel Davis among three charged with threatening parliamentarians | ABC NEWS
description: A member of an Australian neo-Nazi organisation, the National Socialist Network, is among three people who have been charged with threatening and harassing politicians. Joel Davis was refused bail for allegedly encouraging violence against Wentworth MP Allegra Spender. The AFP says they received almost 1,000 reports of threats being made against federal politicians in the last financial year. title: Coroner unpacks Wieambilla triple-murder, finds shooters had 'delusional disorder' | ABC NEWS
description: Queensland's state coroner has handed down his findings into the 2022 Wieambilla attack, which claimed the lives of two young police officers and a local man. The inquest found the killers shared a 'delusional disorder' which was underpinned by religious beliefs, but the murders were not an act of terror.  #ABCNewsQld by Talissa Siganto  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-21/wieambilla-police-shooting-inquiry-findings-terror-attack/106033342  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Tropical Cyclone Fina upgraded to a category two system, as it approaches the NT coast | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) has upgraded Tropical Cyclone Fina to a category two system. The BOM predicts that in addition to making landfall near Cape Don on Friday night, the system is now expected to also make landfall on the Tiwi Islands near Wurrumiyanga on Saturday afternoon.  01:56 Darwin has hit fever pitch in its final preparations for the impending arrival of Cyclone Fina, with winding queues at petrol stations, bottle shops and the city's dump. Reporting by Jack Hislop and Matt Garrick for ABC News Northern Territory. title: NT‚Äôs north braces as Cyclone Fina brings heavy rain, strong winds | ABC NEWS
description: Communities along the Northern Territory's far north coast are beginning to feel the impact of Tropical Cyclone Fina as it draws closer to land. There have already been massive rainfall totals, nudging 200 millimeters in some communities, with strong winds picking up. The cyclone is now a category two system, with conditions expected to intensify tomorrow. ABC meteorologist Nate Byrne takes us through what the coming week might look like.
